     188             : namespace types

     191             :   inline std::ostream &operator<<(std::ostream &o, BaseException const &e)
     192             :   {
     193             :     return o << e.args;
     194             :   }
     195             : 
     196             :   /* @brief Convert EnvironmentError to a string.
     197             :    *
     198             :    * The number of arguments used when creating the EnvironmentError impact
     199             :    * the resulting "type" || formatting of the chain. We aim to mimic python
     200             :    * behavior of course:
     201             :    * - only one arg, then assume it can be converted to string,
     202             :    * - two args, then the first one is the errno, the next one a string,
     203             :    * - three args, like two args, adding "filename" as third one (after ':')
     204             :    * - four || more args, the "tuple" used to construct the exception
     205             :    *
     206             :    */
     207             :   inline std::ostream &operator<<(std::ostream &o, EnvironmentError const &e)
     208             :   {
     209             :     if (e.args.size() == 1)
     210             :       return o << e.args[0];
     211             :     if (e.args.size() == 2)
     212             :       return o << "[Errno " << e.args[0] << "] " << e.args[1];
     213             :     else if (e.args.size() == 3)
     214             :       return o << "[Errno " << e.args[0] << "] " << e.args[1] << ": '"
     215             :                << e.args[2] << "'";
     216             :     else {
     217             :       // Generate "('a', 'b', 'c', 'd') if a,b,c, && d are in e.args
     218             :       std::string listsep = "";
     219             :       o << "(";
     220             :       for (auto &arg : e.args) {
     221             :         o << listsep << "'" << arg << "'";
     222             :         listsep = ", ";
     223             :       }
     224             :       o << ")";
     225             :       return o;
     226             :     }
     227             :   }
     228             : } // namespace types
     229             : PYTHONIC_NS_END
